text: the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of vanilla, toffee, milk chocolate and licorice... the taste is caramel and chocolate with notes of toffee, cocoa, dried plum, fig and brown sugar... sweet and dry aftertaste..
Bitter and malty. Almost a quad-stout hybrid with a touch of dried fruit. Tons of head for a dark beer. Mild, almost absent copper aroma.

Black colour, with a brown head with medium retention. Not much lace. Aroma of dark fruits, plums, figs, chocolate, licorice, some coffee. Medium body, silky palate, normal carbonation. Taste of chocolate, dark fruits, some coffee, plums. Wellbalanced, not specially the best stout Ive tried. I hoped more coming from De Dolle. Correct.

Black. Spicy and yeasty, with a strong and pungent flavour. Lightly sweet taste with tart notes, that ends with a dry, boozy, lightly bitter and ashy finish. Medium body, and foamy carbonation. Overall, a somewhat decent strong ale. The pungent, yeasty flavour and rather dry taste are at odds with the roasted malt.

pocos aromas a torrefacto y maltas oscuras
Aspecto normal, espuma poco persistente.
En boca bastante plana y sin cuerpo

From bottle pours black with big fluffy tan head which takes a while to settle before you are able to take your first sip. Rich aroma of roasty malt, espresso coffee, red berries, roasted hazelnut and a touch of dark chocolate. Nicely balanced sweet and strong flavours along with a far from watery texture, quite oily and thick. Pretty damn fine strong stout

Barwa czarna, z brunatnymi przebłyskami, piana brązowa, intensywna, trwała. 
Aromat średnio-intensywny, słodzona kawa, melasa, nuty porto i słodkiego kakao.
W smaku wytrawne z kwaskowatą palonością. Kawa, gorzka czekolada, i pralinkowe kakao. Goryczka niska, kawowa.

Color negro, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de cuatro o más dedos de grosor (burbujas finas, muy buena retención). Carbonatación a tope. Textura cremosa y muy interesante debido a la elevada carbonatación (combina cremosidad y efervescencia). Aroma hiper sabroso: mucho cacao, azúcar, café, malta torrefacta, alcohol, frutos secos... En boca dulce, con mucha malta torrefacta, cacao, café (sobre todo al final, con mínima dosis de amargor seco) y alcohol (no excesivamente presente, pero sí lo suficiente como para calentar agradablemente el gaznate). En boca, entre trago y trago, queda algo de café y dark fruits (probablemente pasas). Muy completa, para degustar con tranquilidad. 9%.

Bottle. Black. Very roasted/burnt malts. Very chocolatey (dark bitter chocolate). Espresso coffee and burnt sugar. Viscous and tarry. Very salty. Fruit (berries, cherries?). Sour tasting. Dry roast bitter finish. Very Good. (2008)

Appearance: Gorgeous deep, dark brown body with ruby tinges (think cherry wood) & massive head that fills 3/4 of the glass.

Smell: Berries, nut & some wood.

Taste: Roasted & malty with a bit of toffee aspect to it.

Mouthfeel: Complex flavors come to the fore. Burnt-like aspect with solid malt & finishes a little bitter sweet. Very creamy & smooth in the palate & some berries hidden in there.

Reviewed on: 04-14-2008

Piwo czarne metne nalewa sie z obfita lekko bezowa drobnopecherzykowa piana ktora zostawia ladny lacing na szkle. W aromacie czekolada, kakao i lukrecja. W smaku slodkie z wysyceniem na zbyt wysokim poziomie (gryzie w podniebienie), sa suszone owoce i lukrecja. Pio niewpasowalo sie niestety w moj gust.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2017 Mooi donker bier met overweldigende (hier hebben de Dolle Brouwers echt wel een patent op) crèmekleurige parelende schuimkraag. (Te) veel koolzuur. Aroma en smaken van drop, anijs, kruidenlikeur, mout, kandijsiroop. Mooie zoete afdronk, misschien een klein beetje té zoet. Voor de rest een prima bier.

Imperial stout dai chiarissimi e sentori di cacao, cioccolato, caffè e liquosori. Leggermente acida e più scorrevole di quanto si pensi. Molto bella allaspetto, non particolarmente intensa però al naso.

// Beeroda.hu Tasting Sessions 2016 @ Budapest, Hungary // Dark brown almost black color with big frothy beige brown head. Malty, hoppy and light yeasty aroma, roasted, chocolate, licorice, coffee, caramel, pine, wood, vinous notes.

Pinta en la Cervecería IPA(Gijon), Color marron muy oscuro con espuma beige cremosa pero poco duradera, la nariz es su punto fuerte, lo que mas destacan son notas de ciruela pasa, cacao y un ligero recuerdo a vainila, en boca no destaca nada especialmente, cuerpo demasiado ligero para sus 9º, ese es para mí su punto debil, de todas maneras me llevo un muy buen recuerdo sobre todo de su aroma.

Bottle from brought back from Bruges. Pours almost black with a huge frothy beige head. A very lively one. Nice rich liquorice aroma. The taste has more liquorice and treacle with plenty of spice and a light sourness. I would like a touch more sweetness for the style, but still an enjoyable beer.

Bottle from cork and cask. Rich deep brown, craggy beige head. Big malty chocolate nose. Medium body, soft fizz. Dark fruit, prunes and brown sugar. Balanced bitter and sweet. Slightly sticky finish. Good stuff.

Bottle 33cl.
@ 32GreatPower, Seville, Spain.
A: Dark brown.
T: Roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, coffee, licorice.

Bottle. Snifter. Dark brown with big, semi-thick, frothy, light brown head. Poor head retention and lacing. Aroma is moderately to heavy malty, roasted, caramel, brown sugar and moderately bitter. Also some notes of grains, dates, raisins, chocolate and coffee. Taste is moderately bitter and moderately sweet. Some kind of acidity from the middle of degustation. Medium body, watery to oily texture, average carbonation, finish is malty, semi-bitter, dark fruits. Summary: Overall not that bad brew, palate could be better. Nose is too aggressive, fenol-like and Belgian-like.
Bottle. Pours dark brown. Aroma of dark chocolate, boozy fruit cake and coffee. Light sweet with roasty bitterness.

Bottle at home, 8th December 16. Pours black, and lovely, head over spilling. Aroma is berry fruit, liquorice and dark chocolate. Taste is Black Forest gateau, berry sourness, liquorice, dark chocolate, cherry, nice. Lovely gear.
Dark brown with a good light brown head. Caramel, slightly burnt, rum, hint of liquorice and cough drop, bit of red fruit, espresso. Tingling towards the end
UPDATED: JAN 11, 2017 Ziet er prachtig uit, intens zwart, met mooie schuimkraag! Heel fijne smaak en mooie balans. Karameltoetsen. Iets te gassy. Lekker maar weinig spectaculair.

Bottle, 330 ml from Beergium, shared with JFK10000. Pours black with medium light brown head. Roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, sweet, fruit, likely cherries giving the beer fruity sour twist, very interesting. Medium to full bodied. Nice one.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Dark brown body with a massive beige head. Faint lacing. Aroma of Dr Pepper, rum, brown sugar and cherry. Flavour of fig, caramel and treacle. Medium body with a fizzy, frothy mouthfeel. A tasty, unusual Stout - much sharper than I was expecting. More sugary than malty... and far too fizzy.

Butelka 0,33l, data przydatności 02.2017r.
Aromat - Kakao, kawa zbożowa, cukier kandyzowany, karmelki, cola.Wygląd - Barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta, w kropli kieliszka brunatnobrązowa, klarowna. Piana bezowa, wysoka, drobno i średnio pęcherzykowa, długo się utrzymuje, gęsta. 
Smak - Słodkie, kakao, kawa, lekko kwaskowate. Dodatek karmelu i suszonych owoców i lekkiej wanili. Wysycenie spore. Goryczka średnia do niskiej, trochę ziemista. Piwo lekko przegazowane.

33cl bottle at home. Dark brown pour with an impossibly tall tan head with surprisingly good retention. Notes of roasted malts, bitter cherries, oak barrel and macerated cherries, some vanilla, cocoa, chocolate and just a bit of coffee. Medium body, high carbonation and a roasty bitter-sweet finish.
On tap - I think? Not sure. Pours black with a medium brown head. Aromas of licorice, dark fruits, roast, port-ish, candy sugar. Taste is dry, roasty, dark chocolate, tar, ash, dark fruits.
Ei tämä stoutmainen ollut. Vaikkakin hyvä. Ruuan kanssa paremminkin kuin yksikseen. Jaakon ja Samin kanssa Tuulensuussa.

A small taste from a friend (bottle) @ Tuulensuu during the OKS Oktoberfest. Pours very dark brown with a high tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with some chocolate. Flavor is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and hops. With a belgian twist. Great.

Bottle 330ml - cellared for approximately 1-2 years. Served at room temperature. Pours a dark murky brown. Head is enormous, tanned, dense, and mostly lasting. Aroma is of dusted Belgian chocolates; lightly toasted brown bread, cooked brown sugar, blueberries, dried currants, plums, liquorice sticks, a touch of molasses and hints of leather. Flavour is extremely smooth and somewhat vinous, with a very light toasted/roasted bitterness; toasted wholegrain bread, sour grains, blueberries, blackberries, dried currants, liquorice chews (sweets), dark chocolate, horse blanket, and light notes of charcoal in the finish. Medium bodied, with lively carbonation, an oily texture and a long dry, toasty finish. ABV is EXTREMELY well hidden! Quite a decent drop, but a little thin for my liking.

Imbottigliata a luglio 2014, best before luglio 2016, aperta il 18 settembre 2016, 9% ABV.
Tonaca di frate scura, schiuma nocciola chiaro copiosa, di aspetto "saponoso", di media persistenza.
Aroma di caffè, leggero cioccolato, elevata ossidazione, leggera liquirizia.
Al palato prevale sempre lossidazione, che oltre il metallo può ricordare la prugna secca, liquirizia, molto presente il caffè che cede il passo ad una piacevole nota di cioccolato.
Cioccolato che risulta presente anche nel finale insieme ad un amaro tostato ed erbaceo, sempre presenti le note ossidate, piacevoli note di legno.
Corpo tra il medio ed il medio-pieno, carbonazione media, medio-bassa, di certo ha visto giorni migliori, ma risulta comunque piacevole.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2016 33cl-fles bij Gainsbar te Kortrijk. U: Zwart met donkerbruine schuimkraag G: Geroosterde mout, chocolade en karamel. S: Moutbitter, chocolade, drop, geroosterde mout en koffie. Moutbittere afdronk. M: Volmondig met medium carbonatie.
Bottle at home. Pours black colour with a huge beige head. Espresso, dark chocolate, licorice, vanilla and burnt malts. Rich and dark. Enjoyable.

Waaay overcarbonated... Aroma is not even close to a Stout... definately a beefed/darked up BSDA... Fruity yeast funks and dark roasted malts.

Flavor is even more like a BSDA.. raisins and dried sour cherries ... chocolate malts.. with a healthy stir of cocoa powder... only a smidgen of noble hops ... bitterness is too hard to pick out of the dark grains... fruity verging on slightly sour toward the tip of the tounge and lingering on the lips... but still tastes very good... burpy.... coffee Belgian ester burps.
Pours a very dark brown with a rich reddish tan head. Dark roasted malt, fig, and brown sugar nose. Too carbonated. Sorghum, fig, brown sugar, with a fruity sweetness all the way to the finish.

Gigantyczna, beżowa piana, drobna i dość trwała. Barwa ciemno brązowa, prawie czarna. W aromacie karmel, kawa zbożowa, kakao, suszone owoce, cukier kandyzowany, cola... W smaku dość słodkie, palone, ze sporą ilością rodzynek, daktyli, karmelu i czekolady. W posmakach jakiś tytoń, ciemny cukier, likier waniliowy... Goryczka średnia do niskiej, ziołowo palona, lekko pikantna. Wysycenie średnie do wysokiego, musujące w ustach. Półpełne, ziemiste w odbiorze.
Niezły FES, bardziej po belgijskiej, quadowej stronie, czyli estry i fenole w przewadze nad czekoladą i kawą. Piwo nieco przegazowane co zmniejsza pijalność, mimo to przyjemne.
Bottle @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Murky blackish pour with a small tan head. Notes of light smoke, bitter chocolate, coffee sump, liquorice and some light tar.

Bottle. Almost black color with tanned head. Aroma has dark chocolate, roasted malt, caramel. Taste is malty with long bitter and dry aftertaste. Flavors of dark chocolate, roasted malt, caramel, coffee and ripe fruits. Complex and interesting one.

Tap at Oerbierman. Surprised I have never rated this! Dry roasty, bitter. Chocolate and spice. Molasses liquorice and touch of smoke. Great stuff. Dark fruit. Very interesting developing taste with each sip.
330ml bottle. Murky brown with a frothy mocha head. Burnt toast aroma, with dark roasted malts. Bitter burnt toast flavour, along with thick malts and dark undertones.
Dark roasted malt aromas with coffee and some cacao. Taste is a nice bitter-sweet moment, just like that feeling when the glass is empty way too soon. Some alcohol taste during the finish.

Shared 11.2 oz. bottle. Dark brown with a beige head. Very foamy immediately after opening bottle. Aroma of dark fruits, coffee and chocolate. Taste is vinous, some sourness, mild chocolate, coffee notes, hints of vinegar. Doesnt taste much like a stout. Perhaps an old bottle?

Bottle. Pours in dark body, slightly ruby against the light with low to none tan head. Aroma has light chocolate nose, cocoa. Taste has caramel upfront, coffee, chocolate. Full body with medium carbonation.

Diep pikzwart bier met ruime beige schuimkraag.
Aroma: rozijnen en Guinness Foreign Extra.
Smaak: gebrande mout, koffie, bitter.
Mondgevoel is zwaar met weinig koolzuur en een bittere afdronk.

330 ml bottle at home. Dark brown almost black color with big frothy beige brown head. Malty, hoppy and light yeasty aroma, roasted, chocolate, licorice, coffee, caramel, pine, wood, vinous notes. Sweet and bitter like aroma. Medium oily body with average to lively carbonation.

Aroma is raisins and Guinness Foreign Extra and a tiny hint of mirin. Appearance is deep, dark black with a lovely clinging fresh head. Lots of soft, tiny effervescent bubbles. Cannot fault the appearance of this beer at all.
The taste is extremely complex and unusual - leaving a lot to mull over. There are some intense notes of bitter, Italian Roast coffee that come to the surface every now and then. Occasionally a hit of a well balanced, malty, fruit-cakey, ordinary extra stout flavours will dominate. Infrequently acrid, overly dry notes of black malt will crop up and unbalance things rather. Regular waves of light, acidic, interesting sour yeasty, saison-like flavours also appear. The mouthfeel has a depth which betrays the high strength, although the pillow-y Trappist-like smoothness of the mouthfeel of the beer (presumably caused by the addition of the candy sugar) neither hugely contributes-to nor takes away from the experience. It is a beer that I would buy again, but definitely not something I would go to when looking for a comfortable, easy drink.

Bottle.
Pours almost black with a huge beige head.
Sweet aroma with some chocolate and spice.
Taste has roasted malt, dark chocolate, some licorice and a tart note that detracts some. Some belgian (?) yeast as well.
Medium body, high prickly carbonation, dry mouth feel.
Short, dry licorice after taste.

Aroma; lots of malt and apple juice; Appearance: chocolate brown with off white head that billows at first and then settles down slowly; Taste: sour, reminiscent of sour/wild ales that finishes mostly sour with a little hint of stout; kind of odd; Palate: heavy body with long, mostly sweet finish; Overall: not my favorite mix of styles. Would probably not buy again, although its possible it might grow on me.

33 cl bottle shared, purchased for $5.25 at the Craft Beer Cellar - Fort Collins. Black appearance with a huge light brown head. Aroma of chocolate, light roasted grain, light nutty malts and hints of coffee and caramel. Similar flavor, rich, dark and malty with great balance. Medium to full body with a smooth creamy feel. Just an excellent stout overall.

33 cl bottle from copenhagen. Pours black with little head. 
Sweet aroma with some coffee and sweet liquorice taste.

Pours a nice mahogany burnt umber color with a big billowing khaki foam that takes a moment to settle before finishing the pour. Nose is roasty with layers of licorice, tar, some hints of dark fruit and spent coffee grounds. Texture is creamy but the high carbonation keep it from being to full bodied. Nice food stout and another great De Dolle offering that Im finally getting around to rating !
Bottle. Deep brown color with a huge foamy beige head. Aroma of coffee, vanilla and oak. Bitter, quite dry taste. Medium to full body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle from web SB cons 2016-05-05 Göteborg
AR: roasted malt, caramel, 
AP: dark brown, wee fizzy cream brown head
F: belgian yeasty, white sugary dry, sweet liqurice, wee chocolate

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Pitch black with a large tanned head that leaves good lacing. Roasted barley aroma, chocolate, cocoa, licorice and spicy notes. Dry and chalky but also creamy mouthfeel, mildly carbonated. Roasted taste, coffee beans, roasted barley, bitter cocoa and ash, vinous and some fruity notes, green grapes and ripe figs. Warming and dry finish. Deep and complex.
UPDATED: MAY 4, 2016 Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a dark colour beer with a small head. Roasted malts with spices, chocolate and some dried fruit. Dry finish

Bottle 33cl. Poured into a teku glass. Deep dark brown, tall foamy tan head, slowly receding, light lacing; delicate aroma, roasted malts, dark fruits, caramel, cocoa, coffee, brown sugar; taste, light heavy sweet, light bitter, and a light sourish touch, chocolate, coffee, toffee; long lasting leading to a bittersweet finish, still with a wee bit sourness, roasty, coffee and chocolate, spicy notes; medium body, oily texture, average carbonation; complex stout, very special, complex and tasty.

Opaque brown to black with a medium thick dissipating foam. Aroma is semi-sweet, metal, milk chocolate. Mouthfeel is smooth and refreshing with medium to low carb. Taste is sweet and roasted, going on towards a pleasant belgian yeast hint with raisins or dried apricot. Gives a refreshing start, a poignant centre and a vintage-like finish.

Svart med ett mycket stort brun-orange skum som faller långsamt. Doft: Oparfymerad tvål, vått jordgolv, rengöringsmedel, kol, mörk kola, kanderat socker. Smak: Rostat, malt, lakrits, billigt kaffe, kakao, malt, rostat knäckebröd, lite päronsoda. Klart bättre doft mycket lätt kyld.

Released at Systembolaget, Sweden April 8, 2016. 

Dark bron an hazy beer with a huge, four finger high beige-brown head. No lacing stays on the glass. 

Nose: Belgian yeast, brown sugar, roasted malt, licorice, biscuit, coffee and molasses. 
Taste: Coffee, brown sugar, cherry, coffee grain, dark chocolate, caramel malt and raisin. 
Mouth: Medium body and high carbonation. A little bit sourness. Bitter, dry ending.
From tap at Taphouse. Black with a small tan head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, fruit, caramel, chocolate and alcohol.
Flaska från SB. Smak och doft av choklad, rostad malt, karamell, fina kaffearomer med smak av trä, lakrits och mörk torkad frukt. Rund och len, fruktig, fina smaker i god balans med fin beska. Gott!
@ Kristoffers väg 25/4-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Roasted malty with spices, chocolate and licorice, also notes of dried fruits. Body is medium, the finish is dry and roasted with licorice.

Espresso, chocolate, light berries and licorice on the nose, 
Black colour, big tan head, lacing.
Salty, medium bite, lightly astringent, mid-sweet, ABV very well hidden.
Medium body (light considering ABV), fizzy carbonation, salty and roasty coffee finish.
Ok.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen (shared with Niller/Fam) - black pour with tan head. Dark roasted malty aroma and taste with prominent coffee, chocolate, caramel, vanilla, some burnt malty notes, hoppy backing, roasted finish.

Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. Bottled MAR2014<MAR015. Colour is dark brown with large brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, sourness, some coffee, dryness and roasted malts. Aging has not been good for this one. Quite carbonated.

Svart med høyr brunt skum. Lukter jord, salt lakris, mørk frukt, svisker, trevirke og noe røkt. Fyldig. Nøtter, jord, salt lakris, vanilje, portvin og fruktighet mot svisker. Jord og salt sitter igjen.

@ Havregatan 20160420. Bottle (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Roasted malty and spicy with chocolate and liquorice, also coffee and dried fruits, medium to full body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and roasted with liquorice.
Overall: Ashes, peppers, sweet dark instant coffee.Note: On-tap at De Klomp. Reviewed 2016-04-20.
I stort sett svart öl med ljusbrunt skum. Doft av kaffe, mörka bär och lätta chokladtoner. I smaken är de syrliga bärtonerna ännu mer framträdande. Viss nötighet i beskan.

2012 stored at cellar temp, big earthy brett character with some pineapple, cherry and dark fruit roll into chocolate malts on a well carbonated body with rounded texture, clean and smooth with great depth

Fles gedeeld tijdens proeverij, uitgeschonken in La Trappe proefglaasjes. Diepe zwartbruine kleur, met rode gloed, en lichtbruine schuimkraag, levendige carbonatie. Aromas van geroosterde mout, karamel, chocolade, koffie, walnoot, vanille en drop. Het smaakpallet is stevig bitter, zoet gebalanceerd, met tonen van koffie, donkere chocolade, espresso, met daarna een hopbitter en tonen van sojasaus, drop en een licht zuurtje in de finish, aards, rokerig en vineus. Een mooie stout, met veel kenmerken van de bieren van de Dolle Brouwers, levendige carbonatie en een hopbitter door de typische gisting. Deze stout zou ik zeker nogmaals kopen, interessant bier. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark fruits, roasted malts, intense notes of alcohol, beautiful deep brown with reddish reflections, huge tan head not persistant, medium body, law carbonation, roasted, dark fruits, hints of coffee, alcohol present in the aftertaste...belgian stout, with yeast goodness.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2016 Bouteille de juillet 2014, bue après 21 mois. Robe noire surmontée dun gigantesque col de mousse brun-beige laiteux et rocailleux. Arômes de levures, chocolat au lait, baies foncées, épices, grains de café. En bouche, chocolat noir et baies foncées avec goût de levures. Pointes de café et anis. Finale plus amère de grains de café entiers et de malt rôti avec touche chocolatée. Haut taux dalcool bien caché, carbonatation un peu trop élevée. Texture légèrement onctueuse et corps moyen à tendance ronde.

Dark oily brown with red hue, very large head. A: intense red fruit, blue berry, walnut, caramel note, roasted malts. Deep. T: medium oily, medium metal flavour in first sips. Roasted malts, borderline smokey, bbq sauce. Fruity bitter development, red fruits, cherry. Distinct Dolle yeast presence. Bitter aftertaste with walnut notes. Pretty good.
Aroma is soured, apple, vinegar, damn it. Appearance is dark brown, light brown head, foamy as fuck. Taste is soured, apples and vinegar. No sense in rating further.

Flaska från Beergium. Gravöl med kusin Mattias. Flaska som skummar över rejält. Svart vätska med högt, fluffigt skum i brun kulör. Fyllig arom, både av söt kola och riktigt mörk choklad tillsammans med kraftiga kaffetoner. Halvstor kropp. Något syrligare i smaken, med en del chark och ekfat. Fin strävhet tillsammans med lena chokladtoner. En del lakrits. Avslutar i rejält rostade toner med fin beska.

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel. The beer is almost black colored and has a nice cream colored head, with livingly CO2. 
The aroma is malty, sweet and spicy and has notes of caramel, liquorice, roasted malts, dark chocolate and coffee. 
The taste starts sweets with tones of malts, caramel and chocolate and changes into a nice and medium bitterness with tones of hazelnuts, espresso and roasted malts. 
In the finish the strong coffee (espresso) comes back and leaves a dry taste.

Aroma:

Malts, caramel, liquorice, chocolate, roasted malts, coffee and hops.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a small/medium brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel and chocolate; ends slightly bitter with roasted malts, coffee and hops.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2016 33cl bottle, vintage 2014. Served in snifter glass. Poured a very dark brown, almost black with a 4 finger light brown head, very little carbonation. Waited a while for the head to dissipate to get to the aromas. Aromas of licorice, dark fruits, caramel, dark chocolate, vanilla, nuts, port, oak, pipe smoke. Taste: currants, licorice, black fruits, dark chocolate, vanilla, espresso, spices, caramel fudge, whole wheat raisin bread, walnuts, some sour notes in the back as found in the Oerbier, very vinous almost portlike. Full body with a quite dry espresso and dark chocolate finish. Very sticky on the palate. Overall a very good, quite unusual stout from De Dolle Brouwers who have given their own dolle twist to this beerstyle.
Bottle from 2013 bought in schoentje drank centrum(2016). brilliant beer. Aroma chocolate. Coffee. Little bit acidic taste, predominant chocolate taste, if you find it. Buy it!

Keg at La Capsule, Lille, France. Very dark brown with cream head. There is a full on darkly roasted malt body to this, quite heavy on the palate with a roast nut character. Quite complex with fruity hints and a light herby flavour then liquorice. Very enjoyable.

Arôme caféiné et une légère touche de réglisse réglisse
En bouche cest chocolat noir mais avec une finne amertume 
Elle coule vraiment toute seul en bouche vraiment cool 
( bu en pression au sur mesure à nante )

33cl bottle. Cloudy very dark brown (rather than black). Fruity aroma of sour cherries, bitter chocolate. Highly sweet with a sour caracter. For me it is a carbonated version of a Struise Pannepot, very much more like a pannepot than a stout.

Un bière dégustée à lapéro. Le liquide reste coi dans la bouteille au moment où saute la capsule. Je ne me méfie pas. Par contre celui-ci grimpe dans mon verre tel une fusée dès les premières gouttes versées. Une mousse explosive et ridiculement vigoureuse se forme tel un dôme dans mon verre alors quil ny a pas un quart de pouce de liquide au fond. Une fois redescendue, au bout dune minute tout au plus, aucune trace sur mon verre. Celui-ci est rutilant. Des arômes de réglisse noire, danis (non pas de badiane ni de fenouil, de la réglisse), d fruit noir, du sable poussiéreux. Ce nest pas mal construit, mais jaime peu. En bouche le liquide est franchement très mince. Des saveurs terreuses se mêlent à une acidité importante. Très sèche et courte, je suis à cheval entre le café noir, la fumée et la cerise de terre. Encore une fois ce nest pas mal construit, mais loin dêtre dans mes cordes.

Dark brown colour. Light brown medium head. Dark bread and roasted coffee beans in the aroma. Salty caramel at first. Black bread and coffee. Bitter finish. Not oily. Rather medium bodied. Medium carbonated. Well balanced and convincive.

Aromat: wyraźna czekolada chyba we wszystkich odmianach, do tego kakao, wiśnie w czekoladzie, spotykane raczej w mocniejszych stoutach, alkohol, nieco kawy, melano czy palności. Bardzo fajnie skomponowany. Byłoby nieźle, niestety po dolaniu wychodzi wyraźna kwaskowość, (obecna także w smaku), której być nie powinno, bo sugeruje problemy.
 
Wygląd: barwa czarna, nieprzejrzysta. Piana beżowa / jasno brązowa, od drobnych do grubych pęcherzyków, potem redukuje się do tych mniejszych. Ogólnie bardzo obfita (jakby przegazowana), ale umiarkowanie trwała.
 
Smak: niestety wyraźna kwaskowość i nadmierne wysycenie, co sugeruje, że piwo może być niestety stare. A szkoda, bo zapowiadało się bardzo dobrze. Mimo tego nuty czekoladowe czy palone są nadal wyraźnie wyczuwalne, wsparte alkoholem. Goryczka alkoholowo- palono- ziołowa jest w okolicach średniej, drażniąca i trwała. Krągła pełnia, wysokie (zbyt) wysycenie i kwaskowo popiołowy finisz z wyraźną nuta alkoholową. gdyby obniżyć wysycenie, a kwsakowość zastąpić słodyczą byłoby zapewne całkiem udane piwo. Obawy miałem już na początku, bowiem na butelce nie znalazłem żądnej daty przydatności do spożycia.
dark brown , high carbonation malts.coffee a very nice stout with a lot going on at mancbeer fest
Medium brown head, black coloured body, malts metal some yeasts like taste, medium to high carbontion low medium bitter cacao coffee some fresh some malts

Bottle at home. Pours completely black with a huge tan head. Aroma of roasted malt and fruit. Taste is of roasted malts, fruits, lots of hops, spices, coffee, licorice and sugar and yeast. Medium to full body and high carbonation. Bitter and burned with a nice roasted finish that has that De Dolle tartness to it. Pretty damn good.

Bellissimo laspetto, di colore nero impenetrabile; sontuosa anche la schiuma, compatta, a trama fine e cremosissima, molto persistente, di colore nocciola. Al naso sentori di mirtillo, mela verde, una leggera speziatura, orzo tostato; man mano che la birra si scalda emerga anche una leggera acidità (lattico). Annusandola ad occhi chiusi, difficilmente verrebbe da dire che si tratta di una stout. Anche il gusto è abbastanza particolare, ci sono le tostature, cè qualche lieve nota di caffè e cioccolato che ogni tanto fa capolino, ma cè soprattutto una marcata acidità lattica affiancata da note rustiche e terrose. Il gusto, poco pulito, è nel complesso gradevole e lacidità fa sì che questa birra dal 9% di grado alcolico si beva con una facilità commuovente. Il finale è ancora più sorprendente: leggermente salino, una nota di pelle/cuioio, con un retrogusto morbido ed etilico di frutta sotto spirito (prugna, uvetta) e tostature.

Bottle. Pitch black with a lasting dark brown bubbly head. Aroma of dark chocolate, oats, lactose, dark fruits, coffee, hints of liquorice. Taste is of chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, figs, blackcurrants, brown sugar, biscuits, warm caramel and chocolate finish. Medium to hard carbonation, light oily mouthfeel.

Nice tasty Belgian stout!Black color with a fine beige head. Nice smooth intensity in the aroma. Full body and bit to high carbonation. Mild fresh acidity as well. Nice balanced sweetness. Toffee, chocolate, yeast and fruity flavor.[Bottle from a trade with JefVerstraete]

Zwart bier met beige rijke blijvende fijne schuimkraag. 1 jaar oude versie geproefd. Geur: bruin brood korst, geroosterde mout, koffie zuurtje, mineralen. Smaak: zurig  zoetige aanzet die overgaat in bitter  zoet en koffie. De afdronk is geroosterde smaak.

Black colored, strong tan frothy head, nice lacing and very long lasting. Aroma is of dark chocolate, strong dark fruits and licorice, roasted malts, burnt sugar and yeast. Taste is medium sweet malt, roasted, dark chocolate, some burnt sugar, again very strong dark fruits, yeast, some alcohol, quite dry roasted bitter finish and some roasted acidity with a lasting aftertaste. Medium to full bodied, average carbonation.

Bottle. Nose is nut, coffee, hints of ash, raisin, fruit. Taste is strong red wine, leading to nuts, chocolate, plum, blackcurrent and licorice, hazelnut, filter coffee, tobacco. A complex and interesting stout.

Keg at Cafe Beermoth, Manchester. Dark brown with a short tan head. Very interesting throughout. Has a kind of dark chocolate, brown sugar and caramel taste with a dry, raisin-like fruitiness. Quite a bit going on; not your average stout.

Deep impenetrable black pour with huge frothy tan head. Lots of roasty aromas - black coffee, charred meat, with some licorice, cherry and a little red wine. The taste has char grilled steak, light vinous astringency, licorice, a little plum, coffee and a lot of dark chocolate in the finish. Fairly light bodied, oily but highly carbonated. Complex and interesting stout.

Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 26/11/2015
Color negro, espuma beige, sabor torrefacto, seco, toques ácidos. Pendiente de repetir otro lote.

Bottle, no date on cap. Black with a tan head that fades to a fat coat. Aroma of dark berries, chocolate, cigar box (all very Cab Sauv) roasted malt, some coffee. Medium bodied, carbonation just on the high side of moderate. Much more stouty taste, roasted barely, chicory, but the vinous notes are there and so is some sour cherry and maybe a bit of Dubbin. Dry and quite bitter as well as a bit sour at the end. A sipper. Complex, yes, and the stout/ fruity and vinous aspects pop in and out of prominence intriguingly, but didnt hang together. After about half an hour, theres the licorice.
Very good beer. Well balanced sweet, bitter, and sour notes, with long length.

2015/11/17 - Pours a very dark brown (almost jet black) with a thick, frothy, tan head that slowly reduces and leaves minimal lacing. Crazy gusher. Aroma is sweet malt, dark chocolate, espresso, slightly nutty and licorice. Taste is candied sugar, licorice, sweet malt and espresso with notes of dark chocolate and dark fruits. Mouthfeel is medium with high carbonation and a mildly warming, super dry finish. Really good stuff. Wish I had known that this would be gusher before opening. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Black color with huge beige head. Aroma is dark malts, liquorice, dark fruits, candied sugar, Belgian sweetness. Taste is overwhelmingly intense: more fruits, but tart fruits, cherry syrup, candied sugar, burnt sugar below, dark malts, nuts, goes down the throat with a warming fruity finish. Soothing, but high carbonation. It?s like you?re drinking foam (comparable to a Westvleteren, just not as pleasant). The sweetness works out. Uncompromising and daring, which is why we love De Dolle! The only thing to criticize is the high carbonation, really. And maybe you dont liie the sweetness, but I think it fits.

practically black colour, extremely huge, though not really dense dark beige head; aroma of coffee, overripe sour cherry (valami cigánymeggy féle lenne leginkább - ha valaki tud, segítsen ki, hogy lehetne ezt legjobban kifejezni angolul), some ash, dark chocolate, maybe some minimal herbal notes, as well; taste of roasted coffe, burnt woody notes, overripe sour cherry (ismét csak ;-) ) and some chocolate; great stout!

In bottiglia. Colore marrone scura, schiuma marroncino abbondante, fine e persistente. Aroma di torrefatto intenso ,caffè in evidenza, leggera nocciola e cioccolato. Al palato un pò troppo carbonata, sentori di torrefatto in evidenza, caffè, fondo di caffè, finale con nocciola e cioccolato e scaldandosi nota alcoolica e leggermente astringente.

0.33 l bottle from Firma Bier, bottled in July 2014 (a bit over a year old). Clear, very dark red with a very large, foamy, stable, brown head. Roasty, fruity-malty aroma of praline, dried dark fruits, blackberries and coffee. Sweetish, fruity-malty taste of dark cherries, blackberries, dark chocolate, roasted nuts and coffee, followed by a long, medium bitter, coffeish and minimally sourish finish with oaky notes. Medium body, effervescent mouthfeel, very lively carbonation. The faint but pleasant aroma only slightly indicates the intensitivity of the taste. Unfortunately, its highly overcarbonated, thus lacking drinkability a bit. The highlight is the rather bitter and sourish finish.

330ml bottle enjoyed @ home. Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, dark dried fruits and some liquorice. Flavour is sweet and light bitter. Medium bodied, thin texture, soft carbonation. Finish is plain and a bit boring.

De Dolle Export Stout

Bottle from Ghent shared in Osaka. Deep black with a massive pillowy beige head and a huge Rich savoury roasty oat aroma. The taste is chocolate & licorice, a bit sour and thin bodied. Really interesting.

Pours a deep black with a medium-high beige head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of alcohol, coffee, ash with a restrained fruitiness (dark-ish fruits). Taste is dry and features the fruits quite a bit more. It all integrates well with the roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. Moderately bitter. Body is medium, carbonation moderately high and it is surprisingly drinkable. Almost sour, that must help. Overall a really nice stout by De Dolle and pretty much what I imagined it would be. God I love this brewery!

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 4 gwiazdki na untappd: Rami RamidusBrouwerij De Dolle Brouwers by Special Extra Export Stout (2014)Rami Ramidus is drinking a Special Extra Export Stout (2014) by Brouwerij De Dolle BrouwersKwaskowaty, bardzo pijalny, palony, zlozony, wytrawny... Nie do konca moj gatunek ale mrauOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Bouteille de 330ml. Meilleure avant juillet 2016. Une tête rocailleuse trône au sommet de ce liquide brun foncé presque noir. Une nez de noisette, du chocolat et de raisins secs. Une bouche avec de la poussière, une touche de vin rouge, des fruits secs. Lalcool est discret. Loin dêtre désagréable.

Meilleure avant juillet 2016. 33 cl. Au versement, la mousse est dense et montre en hauteur sur cette robe plutôt brune foncée. Au nez, réglisse et torréfaction, mélasse et chocolat, fruits foncés. En bouche, aspect terreux, café et fumée noire. Au palais, un pétillement assez vif qui traverse ce liquide assez mince pour le style. En finale, une amertume de café et de terre. Beau nez mais saveurs qui nont pas cette profondeur. Ceci dit, jai tout bu ma bouteille sans trop broncher.

0.33l bottle. Pitch black body with an enormous light brown head. Aroma of coffee, sour cherry, cocoa and a bit of brett (pineapple maybe). Taste of caramel, chocolate, sour cherry and some earthy and tropical fruity hop bitterness. Very nice.
Bottle from Voldby. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma and taste is dark roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, dark fruits, caramel, notes of licorice. Full body. Creamy mouthfeel. Roasted finish.

Nez démonstratif. Nougat, réglisse et café en bouche. Assez liquide et mousseuse. Des notes herbacées et épicées aussi ( genre cardamone ... ) Du fruité confit ( griottes )... Pas mal darômes, mais avec un côté aqueux ... Presque une porter donc. Pas si équilibrée que ça ... Bien, mais je ne sis pas fan.

Flaske fra Belgisk Bryg, delt med Ovesen: nesten kullsort med højt beige skum som varer. Nydelig, kompleks aroma med lakris, sjokolade, vanilje, tjære, brunt kandissukker, mørke bær og mere til. Førsteinntrykket er en balansert smak uten skarpe kanter. Overraskende lett munnfølelse for sitt høye vitamininnhold - farlig lett å helle over drøvelen. Men det pussige er at mot slutten kommer en lite kledelig surhet frem.
Bottle shared with JMD at HNB 21.09.15. Ebony. Large and foamy brown head. Fruity aroma with dark malt and some star anise. Similar taste. Quite dry. Malt sourness in aftertaste.

Flasche, 0.3l - Abgefüllt: Februar 2013. Extremer geober Schaum. Schwarz. Duft ist eine Mischung aus Wein und Schokolade, fruchtig. Sehr trockenes Mundgefühl. Viel Co2. Leicht säuerlicher schokoladig röstiger Malzkörper. Etwas Rosinen, Pflaume, rote Weintrauben.

Bottle (from beergium.com). Pours dark brown-black with light brown head. The head stays for a long time. Aroma is licorice, fruits, sourness, cough syrup. Flavor is sweet, sour, bitter, roast, cough syrup, dark fruits, dark chocolate, and coffee. Finish is roast-dark chocolate. Alcohol is well covered. Overall: very nice brew.

On gravity dispense at GBBF 2014 on Day 1. Opaque black stout with a thin tan head. Nose is vinegar, little sour, roasted malt, Belgian funky yeast, black coffee, chocolate. Taste is slightly sour, yeasty, slight funkiness, roasted malt, dark chocolate, dark fruit, prune and raisin, and coffee. Not sure there is supposed to be sour in here. Suspect not. Will re-rate again from a bottle soon.

Appearance- black, with a huge pillowy light brown head which settles into 1-2 fingers. Aroma- fairly hoppy, burnt malts, toffee, milky coffee, treacle, vanilla ice cream, waffles. Taste- roasted malts, burnt toast, bitter espresso, toffee, hop undertones, some dark fruits and liquorice emerge as it warms. Quite a lot of carbonation, a malty clingy finish. Very good.

Keg at gbbf 2015 day 4. Thanks sarah. Opaque hazed mahogany brown coloured pour with a fleeting, head. Aroma is roasted, black fruit, Belgian yeast, dried fruit, fruit cake. Flavour is composed of black roasted malts, toasted, dried fruits, fruit cake. Palate is medium sweet, highish carbonation. Really solid.

The color is black, foam nougat colored, dense and creamy. The aroma is partly smoked and sharp tones of roasted malt and licorice. The taste has an unexpected sour tone which I think comes from plenty of bitter hops. Coffee and liquorice and the aforementioned burnt malt takes over quickly and emphasizes that it is a powerful imperial stout. Its pretty intense in its expression, but at the same time very tasty and challenging.
nice stout. Brewery makes several very good beers. Especially the palate is very nice

33cl bottle from some bottle shop somewhere in Belgium. Pours dark brown to black with a huge beige head. Roasty aroma with chocolate, dried, dark fruits, licorice, hints of coffee, spices, Belgian yeast, caramel and nuts. Medium sweet, surprisingly flavourful and quite complex. Finishes fairly bitter. Almost fizzy, at least very lively carbonation, a bit too much for my taste, but altogether a very nice beer.

DAAIÅ; (Drunk all alone in Ålborg) Drunk at Fermentoren. Bottle 33cl. Pours large, brown to black with a frothy creamy, lasting and lacing tan head. Nose is heavy roasted malt and fermented dark fruit, nuts, chocolate, coffee and light licorice. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter, balanced with a lasting roasted, dried dark fruit, warming, light spice and metallic finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily to creamy, carbonation is avarage to lively. Nice..

Aged bottle (? years). Aroma is coffee, brown sugar, burnt malts, hint of spice and some hints of oxidization, even in the nose. Pour is black with a moderate off-white head that recedes quickly. Flavor is, well, quite good (was a tad worried after the nose showed some signs of age...flavor tastes nice) - chocolate at the forefront...loads of chocolate. Hints of coffee and licorice. Lots of brown sugary malts - great flavor! Palate is rich and smooth...maybe a bit thin on the edges, but nothing bad. Yum - good brew...will have to try one fresh down the road!
From XXXII. In Duvel glass. After dinner. Better than the typical guinness stout thanks to its sugar. the coffee taste i dislike is only slightly appreciated in the aftertaste

Aroma is nog niet eens zo slecht, maar qua smaak is dit absoluut niet mijn bier. Smaakt alsof ze siroop van chocolade hebben gemaakt, dit met te veel water hebben gemengd en er vervolgens ook nog eens te veel koolzuur aan hebben toegevoegd. Stout is sowieso niet mijn favoriete soort bier, maar ik heb er betere van op dan deze...
Dark brown with rich light brown head. Sour and bit spicy aroma. Rich tatse of roasted caramel, chocolade, some licorice, touch of coffee and bitter herbs. Remaining bitterness.

Bottle. Dark brown, beige head. In aroma caramel, some roastiness and dried fruits. In taste caramel, chocolate, coffee, fruits. Medium to low sweet, medium body, meedium bitter finish with acidic notes alcohol - it makes it a bit harsh. High carbonation (too high). Overall - I was expecting much more.

Bottle. Opaque black liquid with huge light tan head. Aroma of dried fruit, chocolate, licorice, light alcohol, roasted malt and raisins. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of dried fruit, licorice and chocolate. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.

(Bottle) Very dark brown colour, almost black, with thick, lasting, pale brown head. Malty, roasted nose with notes of liquorice, black rye bread, dark fruit, dark chocolate and hints of yeast. Malty, roasted, fruity taste with coffee, dark chocolate, sweet liquorice, black rye bread, prunes, spicy hints of yeast and a balanced roasty bitterness in the finish. Almost full body, starts fairly sweet, but dries out towards the end. Tasty and well made with lots of liquorice, not as overly sweet as many strong Belgian stouts tend to be. Very nice.
Totally perfect beer, for me. Pheraps, carbonation is too huge. Sweety taste, caramel and chocolate.

Bottle to a pint. Very dark brown. Thick foamy tan head with amazing retention. Malt forward with some spice from the Belgian yeast. Notes of coffee and dark chocolate. A little thin on the back end...
This poured a darker brown to black with a big overcarved brown head. Aroma was of roasted malt, dry chocolate and earth. Flavor was dry and lightly bitter, overcarbed, and roasted. Meg.

Aroma sweet malty, some yeast, some chocolate. Pours dark brown with a rich beige head. Taste is richer than smell and a round palate.
Overall a drinkable nice stout

Bottle shared thanks to estover. Pours a dark brown with a slight light brown head. Aromas of dark fruits, cocoa powder, alcohol, roasted grains. Taste is sweet with a light acridness. Medium body. Light carb.

Poured from bottle, pours a pitch black with a huge tan head and tons of lacing, the aroma is quite odd, sorry cherry mixed in with a hint of chocolate as well, the flavor is slightly sour at first with some vanilla and sweetness in the finish, nice mouthfeel and the abv is well hidden, interesting.

Vierte marrón oscuro casi negro, con excesiva cabeza de espuma que dificulta su servicio; en nariz aromas a cacao, ciruela negra y nueces, en boca entrada media con notas a malta quemada; amargor medio con pos gusto ligeramente amargo y con notas picantes; el alcohol se percibe un tanto, cuerpo medio con carbónico ligeramente alto, cerveza correcta sin más pretensiones.

330 ml bottle
Gusher. Dark reddish brown, almost black beer with huge brown frothy head. Aroma has liquor, mudcake, roastiness, sour cherry and vanilla. Flavor has cherry, toffee, roastiness and bitterness. Palate is medium full with high carbonation. Finish has medium bitterness. Aftertaste has sour cherry, fruitiness, roastiness, coffee and sweet dark sugar. Almost unbelievably thin with this ABV, perhaps the turbocharged carbonation affects it? Other than that, just what Id expect from a Belgian Foreign Stout.

330ml bottle from Belgium in a Box - Black with lasting tan head. Sweet, malty aroma. Rich and full flavoured, a bitter and roasty, liquorice, coffee and chocolate. Palate is sticky with a distracting prickly carbonation. Long warming bitter finish... and a little rum kick too. Not as out-of-this-world as was hoping, but good nonetheless.

Bottle. Very dark brown, seems unclear. Huge fluffy tan head. Roasted aroma with some licorice and hints of chocolate, wood and perhaps ash. Flavour has roast, caramel and licorice. Dry and roasted finish with light alcohol burn. Nice.
on tap at LaTrappe in San Francisco; black color; highly carbonated; roasted malt aroma; dark fruit and roasted malt flavor; fruity finish

Unclear black beer with a beige standing head.
Tastes like caramel, roasted malts, coffee, nuts, and chocolate malt Hops.
Nice long aftertaste.
Pitch dark, clear, rich brown head. Coffee, dry apricots, chocolate, light burnt wood. Carbonated, coffee with chocolate, hint of ashy, passito, wood, coffee bean. Excellent!

Bottle @ De Dolle, Esen - BE. Color: dark black beer with small carbonation and medium brown head. Smell: domination of malt and roasted malt. Notes of caramel and brown sugar. Very sweet domination. Taste: malt and caramel domination. Brown sugar, rye bread. And caramelized finish. Aftertaste: roasted malt, caramel and small alcohol. Very strong for a stout but a must to try!

Bottle, courtesy of yngwie. Pours dark brown with a huge amber head. aroma of chocolate, some sour berries, slight metallic note and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with some chocolate, cellar , nuts, yeast and some bitterness. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle 33cl from Bierhalle Deconinck, @ home.Black color, big tan head. Light aroma of dark chocolate, sour yeast. Taste is a bit sour, dry finish. I was expecting a bit more from this one.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

March 25, 2015. Bottle at home. 
Black with a large tan head. Aroma is ash, plum, chocolate, raisins and licorice. Taste is roasted coffee and ash bitterness light sweet plum and caramel. Medium bodied, average carbonation.

Nydt af flaske i pint. 01-07-14. MHT 01-07-16. Tydelig duft af gær, blandet med diverse kraftige malte; brændthed, kaffe, mørk chokolade, lakrids, karamel, vaniljesødme, brød, dertil også moderat humlebitterhed, også duft af bananer og anden frugt.Enorm brusende, lysebrun skumkrone, som tager nogen tid om at forsvinde, hvortil den efterlader sparsom blondekant. Ingen sigtbarhed, mousserende og mørkebrun. Den starter med moderat sødme; vanilje, karamel, brunt sukket og kraftig bitterhed; helt tydelige lakridsnoter, kaffe, citrus og moderat surhed; brændthed. Afslutningsvis tager sødmen til i styrke, men afbalanceres fint med bitterheden og stadig moderat surhed. Varigheden af smagsoplevelse er lang og nuanceret. Kroppen er medium med mineralsk tekstur, tør og livlig kulsyre. Afsluttende er den moderat harsk og lettere metallisk. Spændende, nærmest champagne stout. Blanding af belgisk ale og engelsk stout:)

Tight white coffee coloured head, which tops a bubbly black beer. Rich stout taste balanced so it is not too sweet or burnt. Does have a tendency to want to leave the bottle before your glass is ready, unless you chill it first. Problem you then have to wait till it warms to fully appreciate it's full on flavour
Koffiezwart kleurig bier met een koffie crème kleurige schuimkraag . Smaak ouderwetse laurierdrop sterke koffie.

Pours an Enormous, and very tanned, dark beige, frothy and creamy head (with incredible duration too); darkest brown to black impenetrable colour. Smells yeast, woody, dried fruits, toasted, some tobacco and basement notes; a really unique blend of aromas. Tastes roasted malts, nuts, cocoa, licorice, some pleasant alcohol hints; low to medium sweetness, medium bitterness, with some hops and coffee notes in the finish; umami. Llively carbonation, medium + body, fizzy and caressing on the tongue; extremly balanced, smooth and clean in the palate, delicate on the coffee. A great and classic De Dolle brew, it is in fact quite a real mix between an imp stout and a strong belgian, with an unusual "sparkling" character and with some very nice particular notes
Chocolate and rasin aroma. Pff white foamy head. Pretty sour yeast flavour. Prumes, dadels, ristretto. Not enough coffee and chocolade for me, not Thatcher good for a stout

Bière brune à la robe noire opaque et au un beau col beige persistant. Son nez fort épais est gras, très parfumé développant des senteurs de réglisse, de malts chocolats avec des relents de café expresso fraîchement moulu, des effluves de pain de seigle allemand et une pointe fleurie. Ce nez élaboré détone un peu avec un bouche pesante: son maltage torréfié, quoique complexe, reste assez lourd en saveurs de café caramélisées, gras au palais et fort rond. Une sensation lactée accentue cette onctuosité avec une petite pointe fruitée surette. En finale, je reçois les saveurs dorge grillé sur des notes aigres que houblonnage accentue un peu laissant la langue rêche. Bière à la signature régionale caractéristique.
Aroma di caffè con finale salato. Schiuma densa, carbonizzazione forse troppo alta, al palato sentore di caffè e noce con un buon amaro finale!!! Una buonissima bevuta! Grazie pazzoidi!!!
On draught at the Dolle Brouwers in Esen. Fluffy head. Chocolate, roast, bitter hop, licorice, barnyard. Medium bodied stout, creamyness is welcome!

Black color with a medium lasting tan head. Aroma has notes of licorice, black chocolate and black ripe fruit. Flavor has notes of coffee beans, chocolate, burnt sugar and slightly ashes in the aftertaste.

Bottle from Malting Pot. Pours dark with huge brown creamy head. Minimal lacing, low carbonation. Aroma coffee, chocolate, roast malts. Medium to full body, somewhat harsh texture. Taste milk coffee, chocolate truffles, cinnamon, first sweet, later turning into malty tartness. Nicely complex.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Negra, con una buena capa de espuma marrón que desaparece lentamente.
Aroma a torrefacto, ciruelas pasas, algo de oporto y un toque ácido.
Buen cuerpo, oleosa y bien gasificada.
En boca chocolate amargo con final licoroso. Muy buena.
Bottled: 2014-04

Bottle, pours black with a large tan head. Aroma: earthy, chocolate, liquoriceTaste: Chocolate (lots), toast, soy, espresso, some citrus. light-medium sweet, moderate bitter, lively carbonation, medium body, oily texture, long chocolate bitter and hoppy finish. A hoppy stout with some saison like traits?

Bottle. Pours dark brown not quite opaque with a huge dense head and some legs. Aroma is fresh dark rustic bread with toasted crust. Flavor is roast. a tad lactic, cocoa, licorice, fairly mild sweetness and bitterness. Alcohol is totally hidden Feel is very full and lively but ends watery. Really nice and balanced. Not especially complex.
Black with creamy beige head. Aroma of roasted malt and soy saus. Taste of dark chocolate, coffee and with a bitter metallic aftertaste.

Wauw, this beer is powerful! Its very bitter (thats what I like) and you can compare it with dark chocolate of 80% cacao and coffee. It also contains a little bit of soy in the taste, which realy completes this beer.
(GUSHER! BEWARE!) 33 cl bottle @ home. Pours black with a huge tan head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are roasted malt, yeast, herbs, nuts, and liquorice - with a bitter finish.
Drank with Tijs, Thierry and Rik at home 21-12-2014. Beer has lots of carbonation. Taste is fairly one dimensional, dark like coffee and chocolate. Taste is fine but not that comprehensive or rich.

From bottle, bottled mar 2014. Pour very frothy. Very dark and syrupy. Chocolate, toffee and espresso flavours. A beer for wintery evenings.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 33cl. Black with a brown head. Coffee nose which also is very present in the mouth. Very high carbonized. Disturbing., simple too much. After some rest I tasted it again, and now the chocolate and coffee flavours are much better. Medium length.

dark brown / almost black color. unfiltered. very tense long lasting head. coffee colored head. smells malty, light smoky notes, light chocolate, fresh, light yeasty, light spices (cloves). medium body, light fruit notes. malt bitterness overlays and dominates all other tastes very quickly. very intense and long lasting bitterness. a bit too bitter and overwhelming for me.
33cl @ bottle. Scura, ottimo aspetto e bella schiuma. Caffé e cioccolato. Ottima.

33cl bottle: Black with a huge tanned head, leaving lots of lacing. (Looks like the stout euivalent o A Duvel incase o foamyness, So pretty awesome. 
Aroma: Licorice, ash,bleuberry, chocolate and bake of bread. 
Taste: Roasted malt bitterness with some cocolate and Licorice notes, hazzelnuts, some bleuberry sourness. Aftertaste is a bitter ashy cacao with some hazzelnuts..
Taste is similar with nice light mouthfeel, but moderate body, dry finish, medium but sparkling carbonation.

(De Dolle Extra Export Stout) Bottle at home, served into a snifter, ABV 9%
Totally black pour, with a huge dark brown head, really thick too, with very good retention helped by its size as well, leaving spots of lacing on the glass.
Aroma has hops, fruity notes, light roasted malts, very appealing and inviting.
Taste begins with a light acidity, then fruity touches, hops, leaves, chocolate, light coffee. Well hidden alcohol. The finish is whats good here, as the acidity fades away and all the chocolate/roasted malts/coffee flavours dominate.
Medium thick body with good carbonation.
Very good, even better after it saat in the glass to warm up and breath a bit.

black like used automotive oil, with a warm, rich brown head, moderately fine, a cm thick, settles to an attractive film a couple mm thick. Aroma is coffee and hazelnuts, slightly sweet maple syrup and candy, some herb, soil, and forest floor. Body is medium-light with a very creamy mouthfeel. Fine, moderately intense carbonation. Flavor is Earthy wet leaf, coffee twinges the back of the palate (like a dry stout), herbs, and a slight, warm nuttiness in the finish. Hint of fruity (cherry) English yeast flavor as it warms. There arent many export stouts Ive had in the last two years to compare this with. Reminds me of Guiness with a more complex, earthy flavor and some more sweetness. The candy, maple syrup, hazelnut notes in the aroma and the top-notch creamy-light body are the defining characteristic of this beer for me. Dank leaves are interesting, but dont serve to make the beer more appetizing.

scurissima con schiuma marrone a grana grossolana,molto persistente..aroma tipico da stout (quasi imperial) ma il tostato era meno forte e si sentivano tantissimo i lieviti belga..gusto un pochetto troppo di liquirizia a centro degustazione,ma lamaro finale (comunque non eccessivo per essere il Nugget) bilanciava il tutto..nemmeno troppo carbonata,è andata via con piacere!
Black, strong brown head. Some sweetness and roastiness, strong chocolate and coffee. Nuts, chocolate and coffee - sweet more than bitter. Finishes chocolatey bitter. Very nice.
Levendig zwart bier met schuim. Smaak is rokerig en bitter, chokolade, koffie en noot. Erg goed bier.
Donkerbruin bier met bruine kraag. Neus van karamel, aroma van mout, koffie, rokerig. Aroma is bitter en zuur. Volle bofdy.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2015 Thick deep colored head, actually still has sediment in the bottom. Charcoal taste with chocolate finishes. Some oak. Heavy but not overly filling. Would have again. Bottle

12oz bottle pours dark brown black with big 3 finger foamy head. Nose has dried dark fruit, old leather, blackberry, dusty dark bitter chocolate and ash. Taste is similar with nice light mouthfeel brought on by high carbonation, some grape, blackberry, ash, leather, bitter chocolate dust, earth. Finish is dry with some fruity notes, coffee, dirt, and bitter ashy cocoa.

Rating #1022, flaske fra Toft Vin. Flot brun med flot skum. Ristet duft med træ. Smag med træ,ristet malt, vanille, desværre en del metal. OK og ret meget præget af træ.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

33cl flesje via 8 Zaligheden, Maastricht
Alcoholpercentage van 9%
Uitgeschonken in Grimbergen glas

Uiterlijk: zwart met mooie crèmekleurige laag die mooi blijft 

Aroma en smaak: gebrande koffie, chocolade, mout, bitterzoet

Conclusie: lekkere stout, Dolle Brouwers altijd wel in orde

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Black pour big head. Hop choco coffee bitter aroma choco coffee taste Dark fruit. Too carbonated-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Draight at the brewery. Dark brown with tan head. A little chocolate and roasty aroma, bitter, roasty taste with faint hints of coffee and a little chocolate too. Full body, dry mouthfeel, roasty aftertaste. Nice.
Bottle. Nice aroma. Dark color worth fine head dissipates quickly. Very chocolatey and rich with coffee overtones. Delicious.
(Bottle) intense chocolate and alcohol aroma. Very dry and alcoholic with very nice chocolate aftertaste. I like it quite a bit but maybe too dry and slightly bitter.
Bottle at home, large head, aroma is coffee, Taste is bitter dry, coffee, hint of fruit, liquorice. Ok beer.

Bottle at Kunstemaecker, Steenkerke, 17/10/14.
Rich mahogany brown with a big old tan coverin that retains very well.
Nose is light roast, dates, fruit cake, liught cocoa, oatmeal tones.
Taste comprises oatmeal biscuit, light spice, hint metallic, earthy, chocolate tones.
Medium bodied, light prickley carbonation, drying close.
Solid export stout, the ABV is well integrated.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Very nice. Huge brown head that dissolves quickly. Dark brown colour with lively carbonation. No sweetness in this one. Pleasant sourness and a flavor that is dominated by dark roasted espresso and yeast. Nice long dry bitter finish. take some time to finish the glass.

Interesting brew. Mostly moderate roasted malts, coffee, dried fruits, berries. Moderate sweet with quite noticeable sourish kick. Feels like farmhouse stout. Not bad, but didnt quite work for me with balance
Aroma is more like Saison, the taste seems to be bit on the plane side and bit dry.

Bottle @ t Brugs Beertje. Pours cloudy nearly black with stable light tan head. Clear aroma of roast, malt and coffee, with touches of liquorice. Bitter, roasty flavour with notes of coffee and malt touches of caramel and chocolate. Bittersweet and sourish aftertaste with notes of cocoa beans. Very good.

330ml bottle served in a Trappist chalice.
A: Pours a dark brown color forming a huge creamy tan head. Good retention. A small layer remains for long time and few lacings are left in the glass
S: Very roasted and toffee. Notes of roasted malts and dark fruits, mainly. Raisins, dark chocolate, Belgian yeasts, brown bread
T: As the nose, sweet and bready upfront. Notes of dark chocolate, biscuit and raisins. Begian yeasts, roasted malts. In overall, a dry taste with a considerable and nice bitter end
M: Medium body and carbonation. Quite smooth and light to such high ABV. Aftertaste is made of roasted malts and good bitterness
O: Nice beer. An authentic De Dolle beer. Good quality. Recommend
[ BA Review @ 9/15/2012 ]

Rather an export stout than a foreign stout, but since both substyles are related, I wont argue about the classification given above. Crackling, irregular, deep beige head collapsing to a thin rim, colour very dark brown with ruby hue which only becomes visible under bright light. Coffee-like roasted bitterness as well as typical Belgian yeastiness in the nose, chocolate, cinnamon, flowers, raisins, candi syrup, peat. Deep malty taste, caramelly and lightly chocolatey, fruity and yeasty, with a warm and mouth-filling roasted bitterness in the end as well as a hoppy accent and some warming alcohol. Very enjoyable, albeit very Belgian stout.

Bottle 0.33l at Belgrade Beer tasting vol.4 from De Hopduvel beer shop Ghent Belgium.Pour it dark color with small white head.Taste and aroma of coffee, caramel, roasted malt, cherry.Perfect balanced sour and roasted taste.

Bottle bought some place I cant remember. Pours hazy dark brown with a huge frothy and fluffy brownish beige head that leaves a small trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is malty and vinous with toasted malts, toasted grains, burnt caramel, raisins, prunes, red wine, moist wood and hints of minerals and soil. Taste is tiny sweet, slightly bitter, tiny sour and malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, dark roast coffee, cocoa powder, soil, red wine, prunes and hints of lemon juice. Mouthfeel is round, dry, slightly tart and medium bodied. Finish is bitter, slightly sour and malty with roasted malts, burnt caramel, lemon juice, red wine, soil, moist wood and coffee. Kinda nice sour stout. Not sure if its supposed to be sour but it works. Feels like I held on to this for too long though
Pours black with a huuge, long lasting, beige head. Roasted malt, light alchool, coffee aroma. Flavor has notes of roasted malt, dark fruits, light alchool with a yeasty touch in the end.

Bottle at tasting in Belgrade. Thanks markoijelena. Rich black-brown, brown head. Sweet, a little sour, on aroma. Sweet tart, red ale notes then hits with strong coffee, chocolate, cherry liqueur. Sparkling carbonation. Rich beer, good character. Some sour notes, cocoa, coffee.

33cl bottle. Deep dark brown colour with a generous brown head. Liquorice, nuts and chocolate in the aroma. Average carbonation and full body. Taste is dry, more than sweet with some coffee notes at the end. A slightly metallic aftertaste. Overall, a very good brew only spoiled by the metallic aftertaste due probably to a bad conditioning.
bottiglia. Aroma alcolico che copre un i malti. si sente caffé e liquirizia. In bocca si ripropone con maggiore presenza di liquirizia (eccessiva) Alti livelli ma  mi ha un po deluso

Bottle at a private tasting in Belgrade/Serbia. It pours black bronish with a tan head. Nose of choccolate, coffee, tons of cappuccinos. Mouth is typical stout with a slight sour feel and a bitter aftertaste.

Aroma: sour cherry, tiny bit of sweet malt
Appearance: black, opaque, brown edges, big bubbles settles to thin foam ring
Taste: complex, vaniilla, cherries, chocolate bitterness
Palate: Low carbonation, medium bodied, warming
Overall: Very suprising stout, like mix of flanders red and regular porter, takes some time to finish but offers lots to tastes buds and warms up really nice!

Deep dark brown looks with big and fluffy head on top. Aroma has dried fruits, roasted malts and some coffee. Taste has licorice, roasted malts, fruits maybe even pear? Ending with some chocolate. Full body and very high carbonation, which in my mind didnt do justice to this beer. Taste was a lot better than the aroma, so in the end this was a nice Stout from Belgium.

Botella de 33 cl de zombier, tomada en septiembre de 2013. stout fácil de beber con tonos de cacaos y maltas tostadas con fácil paso por boca y buena sensación alcohólica con sus 9 vol. Tonos algo ácidos y algo ligera para una stout. No esta mal. Habría que repetirla..

Bottle with desert at Luksus. pours a beautiful dark black with nose of chocolate and caramel. tastes of rich chocolate without being sweet. you also get some nuttiness, roasted malt, caramel, molasses, and cherry. great smooth palate. lovely this is my kind of stout.
Yeast compliments the dark stout malts. Dried fruit character as well in both aroma and taste. Sweet, nutty, bitter, yeast, very complex beer.

Noire d?encre collet brun et cremeux.Aromes magnifiques de chocolat liqueur café. A la fois onctueuse et vive elle surprend agréablement. Les flaveurs de café prennent de l?ampleur et le final amer et long fini de compléter la dégustation.

Bottle. Pours dark brown, nearly black, half finger nut brown head. Aroma is slightly roasted, burnt figs, hint of ripe banana. Some grass and acidity. Taste is slight sweet and then more and more roasted and finish is bitter from the dark malts and dry roast mouth. Body is medium.

Bottle at Fermentoren. Pours Black with a big tan head. Aroma has licorice, roast, dried plums, figs, port wine. Maybe a little banana. Taste is much more roasted, dry and with Dark chocolate. Tarcoal and ashy roast. Semi-Full Body, but Fairly High carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Look: Pours with huge, thick, darker mocha head. It has a very slow, rock solid retention, leaves a thick layer for the whole ride. Dark, dark brown, some carbonation visible. 


Smell: Fresh! Bit of chocolate milkiness in the dominant dark coffee; caramel and candy more hidden but still there. Also some dark berries (wild cherries) and dry fruits, fresh cacao and earthy, spicy notes. 


Taste: Dark fruit freshness, great start, acidity well represented. Continues to medium, lively middle sweetness, again mostly coffee driven. Ends with medium bitterness with small boozy spike towards the end. Strong dark coffee dominates in the after but mellows down with more sips. 


Mouthfeel: Full body, light heavy, lively carbonation, almost dry finish.


Overall: A pleasant surprise, was searching for a fat stout and the bartender offered me this one, was not disappointed. Rich and could easily slip in the imperial stout style.

Aroma: Yeast, chocolate, candy, bit of booze, woody, syrup Appearance: Dark brow, red glow, bug bubble beige disappearing head, medium lace Taste: Mild dry, dark chocolate, light sour, wood, hint of candy, chocalate, mild dry finish

Bottle from CBX. Black pour with a large frothy tan head that hangs out through the entire beer. Aroma of bitter sweet cocoa powder, roasted malts, light hints of dark fruits, candy sugars, yeast funk, star anise with notes of spice. Fairly complex nose. Raisin and plum notes enter the mouth, fading into bittersweet chocolate, coffee, anise, yeast with a spicy and slightly bitter finish. Lively carbonation hides the alcohol. Truely complex and tasty beer.
Stout fantastica della De Dolle, colore nero intenso, aromi di cioccolato e caffè, gusto ricco e corpo alcolico ben nascosto. Fantastica

Ah Boston a town free of, well, the LCBO. Bottle from Charles Street, my new favourite place in the world. Ya De Dolle! Pours as a stout should dark opaque finger or two of tan head. Rich smell. Sweet molasses, roast caramel malts, little fruity red wine, touch of booze. Taste big booze, little sour wine, lot of roasted malts, nice balance. A stout brewed in Flemish beer country. Not your standard stout, but thats OK with me. Suck it Guinness. Tiki you should try this. Tee hee.

Bottle. Deep brown and a little overcarbonated with a huge tan head. Roasty aroma. The initial taste is all alcohol but then it fades quickly. Interesting beer. More chocolatety and malty flavor. Full bodied.

Bottle at Union Jacks. Pours black with a big brown head that has decent retention. The aroma is a bit boozy, some coffee, stove chocolate. The taste has some coffee, cacao, not as boozy as the aroma. High carbonation and a bit dark fruit . Not bad.

Bona cervesa, és bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.

33cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Color is dark. Head is medium to large and brown. Body is medium and quite carbonated. Taste is high bitter and low sweet. Aroma is heavily roasted, looks like a coffee, quite dry and light cocoa and chocolate.
Black, large tan head; aroma of roast malt; taste is sweet, roast malt backed by a nice fruitiness; spicy; enjoyable.

Big tan head very gassy dark pour aroma fruit roast coffee citrus chocolate cocoa the flavours roast coffee bitter is medium cocoa caramel chocolate fruit taste rich strong yeast note light sour note well balanced stout the finish nice yeast and fruit notes good roast malt lasting bitter good stout

Pours black with a low creamy mocha head. Aromas of chocolate, vanilla, dark red fruit, caramel, brown sugar. Taste is chocolate, honey, dark red fruit, caramel. Mouthfeel is smooth with medium carbonation.

33 cl bottle. Quite possibly a 2010 vintage. Pours a dark brown with beige head that was nearly "gusher" level that faded to a thin wisp. Aroma is sweet malts with yeasty bread notes. Flavor is dark fruits, leading with prunes, plums, and slight coffee bitterness. Finish is slightly dry and bitter, with lingering black cherries. A certain Belgian yeast complexity is prominent throughout. A favorite for many years.

Bottle (330 ml). Black with a huge frothy brown head and some lacing. Aroma is of Belgian yeast, roasted malt, liquorice, chocolate and grapes/winey notes. Taste is also quite Belgian with yeast, liquorice, roasted malt, chocolate, grapes/winey notes and light bitterness. Medium body. Moderate/medium carbonation. Slightly mouthfeel. Long lasting fruity (mostly grapes) finish with a touch of alcohol. Good complexity as its almost always the case with De Dolle. Quite tasty. Balance isnt bad either. Interesting for sure.

Bottle, bottled jun09*<jun10. Pours black with a big dense creamy mocha head. Aroma Aroma is roasted malts, cocoa and oak barrels, as well as vanilla, coffee and muscovado. Medium body with soft carbonation. Massive flavour with tart burned malts and dark fruit, as well as tobacco, liquorice, oak and burned burned wood. Lingering burned and malty finish, with dark fruits.

Pours a jet black with a very foamy off-white head. Aroma is oak and malts. I also get a very strong oak flavor, as though this was aged in bourbon barrels for a while. There are some roasted malts, chocolate, and a decent amount of bitterness. While I do like this, it also comes off as a bit much in terms of the combination of oak and bitterness. Theres a touch of sweetness that goes too far, in a way, but another part that makes it a very nice sipper as it warms up.

Aroma: iron, toasted malts, chocolate, coffee. Appearance: dark brown/black, medium creamy beige head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: quite some bitterness expanding, turning dry in three average-long finish. Overall: great Foreign Stout, nice dryness. Pint at The Times, Ypres.

Bottle, 18 months old. Dark brown with a huge foamy beige head. Aroma - dishwater, yeast, slight smoke, touch of booze. Body - medium to light, low carbonation, quite foamy. Taste - dank caramel, sweet date, red berries, milky coffee, finishes dry and tart with some alcohol. A bit weird - it has a sharp tartness that I assume isnt meant to be there. Drinkable (slowly).

on tap @ Taste of Belgium / Cincinnati OH --- Opaque black/brown with a full 3" head that never goes away, wisps of lace. Taste is musty sweet malt, but it quickly becomes bitter roasted chocolate, adding effervescence in the finish. A full bodied brew, great for sipping.

Pours a dark stout with a nice stable beige head.
Smells like coffee and roasted malts. Has a bit of liquorice also.
Tastes sweet and burnt. Has a really nice and interesting after taste.
Great stout!

Pours an almost black liquid with little head. Very easy drinking for a stout and the aftertaste is almost never ending. Tastes of coffee, and burnt barley - maybe a little too bitter but pretty much bang on. A very good example from such a varied brewery
11.2 oz bottle. Black beer with brown head. Coffee and alcohol aroma. Coffee and chocolate taste. Boozy and bitter aftertaste.

On Keg at North, pours black withe a foamy tan head. Chocolate and coffee with dried fruit flavours, cherries, plums. Light body for the abv and goes down very nicely for 9% abv. Finish is balanced. Carbonation lively for a strong stout.

Bottle at Novari Res. Pours black with a lasting creamy beige head but leaves only a bit of lacing, Aroma is caramel, roasted malts, chocolate and coffee in that order. Medium to thick body, average carbonation, medium to heavy sweet, light bitterness in taste, oily texture and a dry bitter and sweet finish. Excellent.

Deep black with big thick tan head. Raspberries, grapes, green apples, some chocolate and coffee, funk, roasted malts, liquorice. Big complex fruity tartness, with an underlying sweetness and nice roasted bitter finish. Mediun to full bodied, nice full carbonation. Not a typical stout, but great complexity, especially in the taste. Love it.

Bu à la pression en 33cl à la brasserie, couleur noire avec une grosse mousse onctueuse, odeur de grillée et de caramel, en bouche on ressent surtout le bon café fraîchement torréfié, une tuerie encore...

Bottle @The Vintage, Leith. Pours black with a good tan head. Fruit nose but light, not a big nose but what you do get is lovely. Raisins and other dark fruits a little prickle from the cO2 on the palate. Hints of licorice, coffee and chocolate but a big dollop of fruit, nice.

Aroma: caramel, chocolate, coffee, nuts, resin
Appearance: black, cloudy, head brown
Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter
Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
330ml Flasche. Sehr dunkelbraunes Bier mit schöner bräunlichen Schaumkrone. Geruch angenehm röstmalzig, Kaffee, Schokolade. Geschmack nach dunkler Schokolade, Karamell, Kaffee.

Tonight with a few friends I opened a 2004, 2008, and 2013 vintage of this beer. I have already known from previous experience that this beer seems to age exceptionally well, especially for its not particularly very high abv. What is a very respectable and well-balanced stout in the fresh version turns into something magical in the older versions. On the first tasting, I felt the 2008 was the uncontested champion, but as a sipped more, the 2004 seemed more and more a contender. No off-tastes or anything unpleasant even in the ten year old version. What a terrific beer, and there is no better argument for the potential benefits of carefully aging certain beers then this extra export stout.

Thin black brown with translucent edges and robust carbonation. Notes of dark malt, burnt coffee, and sour cherries. Slightly tart and lively from the carbonation. Dark malts, tart cherry, anise, light coffee/cocoa. Belgian for sure...reminiscent of Hercules, but with less stewed fruit, much thinner bodied, and more carbonation. Interesting.
UPDATED: JAN 27, 2014 @t Antwaerps Bierhuyske. Dark brown to black color, dark beige head. Sweet litlle bitter aroma. Biteer sweet taste. OK.

Una delle migliori stout belge insieme a quelle di Struise, qui De Dolle davvero si supera! Gusto molto ricco, di cioccolato e caffé intenso, con sfumature speiate, di liquerizia e nocciola. Corpo nero e impenetrabile, grado alcolico ben mascherato. E davvero eccezionale!

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 33cl bottle served in a snifter. Pours dark brown with a bubbly, billowy head which makes the prospect very inviting. Unfotunately, this is where the positives end. Aroma is ok but not very imperial stout-like. Taste is coffee and an almost redcurrant-like tartness. A little odd for the style and a thin to medium mouthfeel contribute to this being less I expected. Not worthy of the mad brewers moniker.

A wild kind of stout. Some roast malt, something that tastes like wild sour cherry, a little chocolate and a very robust smell all around. Pours black with very huge initial foamy head and some decent lacing. Finishes bitter and sour in equal big parts. A touch of booze in finish. Great foreign stout - getting near the Russian empire. Thick palate, low carbonation. Bottle.

Havent had many Belgian stouts and this is about what one would expect from one. Dark body with brown head, loads of head, a gusher. Roasted malt and tart funky notes as well. Taste is somewhere in between a stout and a flemish red, sour finish, also belgian sugar sweetness, cherries. Abv well masked. Cool and interesting beer.

330 ml from Birsciop, served in a snifter. Bottled on February 2013. Pitch black colour, no light passing through, with a huge, frothy, forever lasting dark beige head. Intriguing aroma, with tons of spices (cinnamon, vanilla, liquorice) dark fruits under spirit, sugar cane and a bit of booze. Some grassy hops as well, surprisingly after almost one year of the bottling date. Perfectly balanced in the mouth, with the roasted and chocolaty department on one side, complemented by a sweet, alchoolic and slightly tart/sour quality on the other side. A bit of smoke and ashy sensation on the tongue. Average carbonation, on the higher side of medium body, and oily finish. Some trace of the alchool during the aftertaste, but absolutely pleasent. A classic.
Bottle from a friend. Fruity and yeasty smell with some chocolate and coffee. Similar taste. Roasted bitterness and some burned bread. Quite harsh mouthfeel. To much roasted malts.
Thick tan head, darkest brown full bodied Belgian style Stout. Chocolate, roasted malts and underlying sourness. I liked this Foreign Stout, had all the qualities true to style.

Oily dark and thick. Coffee and dark chocolate abound, with good hop balance and a touch of sour/funk keeping it interesting. Maybe Brett? Lends a sour pie cherry note, making the beer somewhat black Forrest like.
